Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students will explore a variety of careers within the field of K-12 education. Course experiences will introduce students to career and life planning theories and concepts and how to apply these to their own lives.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

EDG2311 - Teaching Strategies for Substi.name: EDG2311 - Teaching Strategies for Substitute Teachers

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Planning, adapting and implementing effective instructional practices and assessing student performance in K-12 settings with diverse populations.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Field experience in an appropriate educational setting under the direction of a supervising teacher and/or university supervisor.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students will learn about the field of education through a variety of field experiences. Course experiences will rely heavily on students' engagement in these targeted field experience placements and their structured reflections.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A guided field experience for students participating in a study abroad program. Students gain insights into global and local issues through educational and cultural experiences.

Prerequisites.text: EDG 4410, admission to Elementary Education B.S. Lifelong Learning track, Exceptional Education B.S. Lifelong Learning track, Secondary Education B.S.: Physical Education Lifelong Learning track, English Education Lifelong Learning track, Mathematics Education Lifelong Learning track, Science Education-Biology Lifelong Learning track, Science Education-Chemistry Lifelong Learning track, Science Education- Physics Lifelong Learning track, Social Science Lifelong Learning track

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To provide students a well-rounded view of informal education settings with a concentration on developing interpersonal, pedagogical, and leadership skills required for becoming a successful contributor to educational enterprises.

Prerequisites.text: EDF 2005, and Admission to Elementary Education Pending, Elementary Education B.S. (all tracks), Secondary Education Pending, Secondary Education B.S. (all tracks), Early Childhood Education Pending, Early Childhood Education BS (all tracks), Exceptional Education Pending, Exceptional Student Education B.S. (all tracks), Music Education B.M.E. Music Education Pending, or any Education Minor, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Instructional, organizational and classroom management strategies to create effective learning environments. Fifteen hour in-school experience required.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Involvement with not-for-profit agencies and/or schools to gain a new perspective on civic/community engagement.
